required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Prediction of Secondary Neurological Deterioration in Patients With Moderate Traumatic Brain Injury
clinical_study.official_title: Prediction of Secondary Neurological Deterioration in Patients With Moderate Traumatic Brain Injury : an Observational Study

brief_summary.textblock: Patients with moderate traumatic brain injury (mTBI) are 1,5 times more frequent than those with severe TBI and some of them will develop secondary neurologic deterioration (SND) within the first 7 days. However, identifying at risk patients of SND is still challenging. This study aimed to determine risk factors associated with SND after mTBI.

primary_outcome.description: SND was defined either by a decrease in GCS or by a deterioration in neurologic status sufficient to warrant intervention like mechanical ventilation, transfer to the ICU or neurosurgical intervention

study_pop.textblock: All adults admitted in Brest hospital (ICU and wards) between 2015 and 2018 for moderate TB

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults
- Admitted in Brest hospital between 2015 and 2018 for moderate TBI, defined by Glasgow coma scale (GCS) score 9-13
Exclusion Criteria:
- Non consenting patients

patient_data.ipd_description: All collected data that underlie results in a publication
patient_data.ipd_time_frame: Data will be available beginning three months and ending five years following the publication
patient_data.ipd_access_criteria: Data access requests will be reviewed by the internal committee of Brest UH. Requestors will be required to sign and complete a data access agreement
